face_recognizer.src.front package¶

Submodules¶

face_recognizer.src.front.UI_automatic_photos_taker module¶

This module implementes an interface window that allows the user to create/generate photos (data) automatically.

Displays the current status (whether photos are taken or not) to inform the user.

launch_FaceRecognizer(model_saving_path, classes)[source]¶

Launches the application.

Parameters

  • model_saving_path (str) – path where to save the model trained.

  • classes (list(str)) – classes (i.e. names) of people to recgnize.

Launches the data processing phase.

Launches the training phase.

Parameters

  • current_working_directory (str) – path the to the Current Working Directory (CWD).

  • model_name (str) – name of the model.

popupWindow(window_title, text, icon, informative_text, buttons_number)[source]¶

Pops up a window when the user wants to start the images processing phase.

Parameters

  • window_title (str) – Title of the popup window.

  • text (str) – text to display in the popup window.

  • icon (message.setIcon() instance) – type of icon to display.

  • informative_text (str) – additional text to display.

  • buttons_number (int) – number of buttons. NOTE: That is an argument used by the programmer that allows him to re-use this function several times with 1 or 2 buttons.

face_recognizer.src.front.UI_configuration_window module¶

This module implementes an interface window that allows the user to: * provide the location of the main directory storing all the data, the model and other information. * specify whether he/she wants to add new data to the old one (and hence train a new model) or not (launch the application directly).

face_recognizer.src.front.UI_prepare_photos_taking module¶

This module implements an interface window that appear immediately after the configuration window (only if the user decides to generate new data). Basically, it is a second configuration window that asks the user to: * specify how he/she wants to take photos (either manually or automatically). * specify the names of all people/classes he/she wants the application to be able to recognize. * provide the name of the model to be trained.

face_recognizer.src.front.UI_welcome_window module¶

This module implements an interface window that appear when the application is launched. Basically, it is a simple menu asking the user if he/she wants to start the application or not.

Todo

Add a cancel button to the window.
